title: [SOLVED]A1278 Question
message:
This poor girl, I changed her screen a few weeks ago and just came back dead.  No liquid damage.  I changed Q7822 & ultrasoniced (how DF you spell that)?, But I never tested in between so I don't know which "fixed it" Anyways.  Power is back up and get a loading bar of infinity.  

Did some monkey see and doing:  [COLOR=#000000][FONT=Roboto][SIZE=13px]/sbin/mount -uw / Then type chmod 775 / [/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]  & it'll work.  But have to do that everytime? Otherwise it don't boot. Toot, toot.

title: [SOLVED]A1278 Question
message: Corrupted OS? Do a PRAM reset and run Diskwarrior to check filesystem.

title: [SOLVED]A1278 Question
message:
​[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER]  Do you use diskwarrior to recover corrupted/deleted files from HDD's/SSD?

How often do you get a drive to recover files from?

title: [SOLVED]A1278 Question
message: UFS is for recovering deleted files. Diskwarrior is for fixing a fucked partition from improper shutdown or something.

title: [SOLVED]A1278 Question
message:
I'm more of the hardware guy.  I got my buddy to fix it.  He says it was fucked up partition from an update or something?  Thanx though.  I hate Apple stuff with an extreme passion.  
But I will keep this in mind and it is here in stone for others and for future reference : )  Thanks guys : )
